service.title: The Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) GET-Location header
service.documentation: Several hypertext transfer protocol (HTTP) extensions use methods other than GET to expose information. This has the drawback that this kind of information is harder to identify (missing a URL to which a GET request could be applied) and to cache. This document specifies a simple extension header through which a server can advertise a substitute URL that an HTTP client subsequently can use with the GET method.

http-header.documentation: The GET-Location entity header identifies a substitute resource that can be used in subsequent requests for the same information, but using the GET method.
